description: Chopped rotisserie chicken stands in for whole chicken breasts in this timesaving skillet dinner from Food Network Magazine. Though the process is simplified, all of the usual accoutrements are here: San Marzano tomatoes, mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. Throw in some thawed artichoke hearts for more meaty texture.

This dinner is as simple as dumping everything into a pot — dry noodles, tomatoes and all — and letting it simmer. The liquid from the stock will absorb into the pasta and create a rich, flavorful sauce.

Creamy avocado and smoky chorizo crumbles unite over a crunchy baked tortilla in this easy Mexican pizza recipe. Refried beans stand in for classic tomato sauce, and Oaxaca cheese makes an excellent substitute for standard mozzarella.

For once, water and oil work together to make a magical one-skillet weeknight chicken dinner. Potatoes cook alongside crispy chicken thighs — first they boil in water until tender, and then fry into golden nuggets in the remaining oil.

tilte: Grilled Chicken Quarters with Ras el Hanout
description: Ras el hanout is a blend made of several spices so it’s worth keeping in your pantry as a powerhouse ingredient. Here, it adds tremendous depth and complexity to an easy yogurt marinade, which doesn’t need much more than lemon juice and a few cloves of garlic to brighten the flavor of grilled chicken legs. Scoring the chicken a few times helps it better absorb the marinade and the yogurt makes it extremely juicy. Complete this flavor-packed dish with a side of potatoes, rice or salad.
Ree puts a fresh twist on the charcuterie board with her fun and festive salad, which is cooked from start to finish on the grill.
